results.title: Sister, if you only knew
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker and Janet Isaac
results.brief_description: The theme of this film is about the pressures on Aboriginal women living in the city…what effect it has also on their men and their children. The film focuses on four women and the part they played in the movement demanding more equal opportunities for urban Aboriginals, for better conditions, the removal of discriminatory Acts, etc. Although life is difficult the women seem to survive better than the men. Their humour, intelligence and resilience in the face of life’s difficulties often surprise people who see this film. The women are Leila Rankine (Music and Tribal Culture Education), Ruby Hammond (Legail Aid), Mary Williams (Aboriginal Kindergarten) and Gladys Elphick, MBE (President, Aboriginal Women’s Council).

results.title: Sister Wendy's odyssey. -Volume 2
results.creator_credit: BBC, Nicholas Rossiter and John Hooper
results.brief_description: Sister Wendy Beckett has a passion for art and leaves the confines of her religious silence in search of the art treasures she has found in books and on postcards. For Sister Wendy art represents a window to something greater, and when one is looking at art, one is looking at God. In this second part of the odyssey in which Sister Wendy openly shares her first impressions of seeing the art she’s admired, she visits Wilton House, Birmingham, and Edinburgh stopping to reflect on her favourite pieces. PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS A CLOCK TIMER BETWEEN EACH EPISODE ON THE TAPE.

results.creator_credit: BBC, Nicholas Rossiter and John Hooper
results.brief_description: Sister Wendy Beckett has a passion for art and leaves the confines of her religious silence in search of the art treasures she has found in books and on postcards. results.title: Sister my sister
results.creator_credit: NFH Films, Channel 4, Norma Heyman and Nancy Meckler
results.brief_description: Based on a murder case which occurred in 1934 in a provincial French village, this psychological drama is set almost wholly within the claustrophobic confines of a bourgeois household. Two sisters are employed as maids for a prudish, arrogant, middle-aged widow and the frumpy grown daughter she clings to for companionship. Immaculately groomed and discreet, the sisters slave endlessly without complaint for years to meet the perfectionist standards of the mistress of the house. Seeking any relief from this cold, oppressive environment, the sisters, who are also bound to one another in an unhealthy co-dependent relationship, eventually become lovers. As their relationship becomes increasingly tortured, the burden of meeting their employer’s expectations strains class tensions to breaking point. Beginning with the scene of the horrific murder that almost inevitably occurs, the film then effectively builds the pressure cooker atmosphere of class division, sexual repression and co-dependence that provided fertile ground for this seemingly incomprehensible crime. Cast: Julie Waters, Joely Richardson, Jodhi May, Sophie Thursfield.

results.title: Sister Forsythe's casebook
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Barry Pierce and Jack Zalkalns
results.brief_description: Outlines the work done by a school community nurse in early detection of potentially serious health problems in students. Shows diagnosis of petit mal, child abuse, depresion resulting from overweight, bed wetting, poor coordination. Notes how the school nurse works in conjunction with parents and techers.

results.title: Sisal
results.creator_credit: East African Railways and Harbours Film Unit and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the cultivation and treatment of sisal, a raw material for rope making, in Tanganyika. Shows the way in which the leaves are removed from the sisal plant and conveyed to the decorticator machine; also the drying, grading, brushing and baling of the fibre. Illustrates the uses of the fibre; traces the history of the industry in East Africa and mentions problems associated with growth, processing and marketing.

results.title: Siroseeder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Siroseeder is a machine designed to spray a herbicide, cultivate the soil in narrow rows, insert seed and fertilizer at a predetermined depth, replace the soil and press it down lightly. Normally. farmers could use four implements and make up to eight passes to do the same job. If these and other experiments are fruitful, inputs of time, labour and fuel will fall dramatically, as will the risk of soil erosion.

results.title: Sirocco
results.creator_credit: Santana Pictures, Robert Lord and Curtis Bernhardt
results.brief_description: Harry Smith (Humphrey Bogart) is a casino operator and underground gun runner supplying Arab insurrectionists with guns against the French in 1925 Damascus. His life is about to become even more complicated when he is arrested by the French, then approached by Colonel Feroud (Lee J. Cobb) for secret miliatary information - the reward, liberation from war-torn Damascus. Feroud and Smith become rivals when Smith becomes involved with the frenchman’s mistress, Violette (Marta Toren). The betrayal and violence that ensues causes Smith to question the morality of his actions and his life in Damascus.

results.title: Sirius puppy training with Dr. Ian Dunbar
results.creator_credit: Bluford-Toth Productions, Martin Bluford and Beth M Toth
results.brief_description: This video is the first comprehensive obedience, behaviour and temperament training program designed especially for puppies. Emphasising family participation, this video shows owners how to teach their puppy basic obedience commands such as “come”, “sit”, “heel”, and “stay”. Through daily handling and calming exercises, your puppy can also be taught to overcome biting, barking, and housetraining behavioural problems. The aim of the video is to train dogs to be good companions and a joy to live with.
